summary: This is a brief email correspondence from July 11, 2019, containing a link to a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein's net worth. The sender appears to be an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, referencing the article with a comment suggesting prior knowledge or prediction.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email contains a link to a New York Times article about his net worth, indicating he is the central subject of the referenced financial reporting.

events.title: NYT publishes article on Epstein's net worth
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article detailing Jeffrey Epstein's net worth and financial situation.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent an email on July 11, 2019, referencing a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein's net worth.
The email's subject line includes 'Deutsche!', which may be a reference to Deutsche Bank, a financial institution later scrutinized for its relationship with Epstein.
The sender's comment 'Did I call it or did I call it' suggests prior awareness or prediction regarding the content of the financial article about Epstein.
